intro: Gomphostemma lucidum, commonly known as the shining gourd, is a climbing vine native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by yellow or orange fruits that are typically pear-shaped. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
